perturbation.original_text: 15.4 User Data. All information and data provided to Intuit by users of the --------- Intuit Sites or otherwise collected by Intuit relating to user activity on the Intuit Sites shall be retained by and owned solely by Intuit. All information and data provided to Client by users of the Client Site or otherwise collected by Client relating to user activity on the Client Site shall be retained by and owned solely by Client. Each party agrees to usesuch information only as authorized by the user and shall not disclose, sell, license, or otherwise transfer any such information to any third party (except as required by law) or use the user information for the transmission of "junk mail," "spam," or any other unsolicited mass distribution of information.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.4 User Data. All information and data provided to Intuit by users of the --------- Intuit Sites or otherwise collected by Intuit relating to user activity on the Intuit Sites shall be retained by and owned solely by Intuit. All information and data provided to Client by users of the Client Site or otherwise collected by Client relating to user activity on the Client Site shall be retained by and owned solely by Client. Each party agrees to usesuch information only and shall not disclose, sell, license, or otherwise transfer any such information to any third party or use the user information for the transmission of "junk mail," "spam," or any other unsolicited mass distribution of information.
perturbation.explanation: Omitting the phrase "as authorized by the user" removes a critical protection regarding user data. California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and other state laws require businesses to obtain explicit consent for the use of personal information. Removing this restriction allows Intuit and Client to potentially use user data without proper authorization, creating a legal risk.

perturbation.original_text: 16.5 DISCLAIMER. EXCEPT AS SPECIFIED IN THIS AGREEMENT, NEITHER PARTY MAKES ANY ---------- WARRANTY IN CONNECTION WITH THE SUBJECT MATTER OF THIS AGREEMENT AND HEREBY DISCLAIMS ANY AND ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES AND CONDITIONS, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE REGARDING SUCH SUBJECT MATTER.
perturbation.changed_text: 16.5 DISCLAIMER. NEITHER PARTY MAKES ANY WARRANTY IN CONNECTION WITH THE SUBJECT MATTER OF THIS AGREEMENT AND HEREBY DISCLAIMS ANY AND ALL WARRANTIES AND CONDITIONS REGARDING SUCH SUBJECT MATTER.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause contains the language 'EXCEPT AS SPECIFIED IN THIS AGREEMENT' which provides at least some minimal protection. Removing 'EXCEPT AS SPECIFIED IN THIS AGREEMENT, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE' eliminates any obligation for the service to be fit for the general purpose of online advertising violating consumer protections laws and creates legal risk.

perturbation.original_text: 18.2 Applicable Law and Jurisdiction. This Agreement and the performance of ------------------------------- the parties under this Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California, U.S.A., except that body of law concerning conflicts of laws. In any action relating to the parties, the parties consent to jurisdiction in a state or federal court in Santa Clara County, California.
perturbation.changed_text: 18.2 Applicable Law and Jurisdiction. This Agreement and the performance of ------------------------------- the parties under this Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, U.S.A.. In any action relating to the parties, the parties consent to jurisdiction in a state or federal court in Kent County, Delaware.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the jurisdiction from California to Delaware can be a significant omission because California has strong consumer protection laws, while Delaware's laws are generally more corporation-friendly. This shift could limit the consumer's ability to pursue certain legal remedies or enjoy the consumer rights they would have had under California law. Delaware courts also are not easily accessible to California residents, further limiting consumer options.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially various California consumer protection laws (e.g., consumer privacy, false advertising)
